meanings.sent1: She is the naggiest person I know, always finding something to complain about.
meanings.sent2: The naggiest customer at the store constantly demands refunds for minor issues.
meanings.sent3: The naggiest cat in the neighborhood meows loudly every morning for breakfast.
meanings.sent4: Her naggiest tone cut through the room, making everyone uncomfortable.
meanings.sent5: The naggiest rainstorm we've ever experienced flooded the streets within minutes.

meanings.definition: Naggiest: characterized by constant complaining or fault-finding
meanings.sent1: His naggiest behavior at work led to conflicts with his colleagues.
meanings.sent2: The naggiest customer at the restaurant complained about every dish served.
meanings.sent3: The naggiest alarm clock never fails to wake me up with its loud ringing.
meanings.sent4: The naggiest wind howled through the night, keeping everyone awake.
meanings.sent5: The naggiest teacher in the school always finds something wrong with students' work.

meanings.definition: Naggiest: tending to nag or annoy persistently
meanings.sent1: The naggiest child in the class always asks for more snacks during lessons.
meanings.sent2: Her naggiest friend keeps reminding her of tasks she needs to complete.
meanings.sent3: The naggiest squirrel in the park chatters non-stop, bothering visitors.
meanings.sent4: The naggiest engine in the old car sputtered and coughed before finally starting.
meanings.sent5: The naggiest alarm system beeped incessantly until the code was entered.
